metadata.Title: CVE-2014-8369 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The kvm_iommu_map_pages function in virt/kvm/iommu.c in the Linux kernel through 3.17.2 miscalculates the number of pages during the handling of a mapping failure, which allows guest OS users to cause a denial of service (host OS page unpinning) or possibly have unspecified other impact by leveraging guest OS privileges.  NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incorrect fix for CVE-2014-3601. The KVM (kernel virtual machine) subsystem of the Linux kernel miscalculates the number of memory pages during the handling of a mapping failure. A guest OS user could exploit this to cause a denial of service (host OS page unpinning) or possibly have unspecified other impact by leveraging guest OS privileges.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8369` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-41-generic - 3.13.0-41.70
linux-image-3.13.0-41-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-41.70
linux-image-3.13.0-41-lowlatency - 3.13.0-41.70
linux-image-3.13.0-41-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-41.70
linux-image-3.13.0-41-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-41.70
linux-image-3.13.0-41-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-41.70
linux-image-3.13.0-41-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-41.70
linux-image-3.13.0-41-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-41.70
linux-image-extra-3.13.0-41-generic - 3.13.0-41.70
No subscription required

linux-image-3.16.0-26-generic - 3.16.0-26.35~14.04.1
linux-image-3.16.0-26-generic-lpae - 3.16.0-26.35~14.04.1

notes.Note: jdstrand> android kernels (flo, goldfish, grouper, maguro, mako and manta) are not supported on the Ubuntu Touch 14.04 preview kernels linux-lts-saucy no longer receives official support linux-lts-quantal no longer receives official support

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-41.70').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-grouper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-lts-utopic package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.16.0-26.35~14.04.1').
linux-lts-vivid package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1').
linux-maguro: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-manta: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-signed package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-41.70').
